description: Beef shin becomes meltingly tender when slow cooked in this rich and impressive stew with earthy porcini.
name: Rich Beef Shin & Wild Mushroom Stew Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1.6kg beef shin, 6 bone in pieces, chilled

recipeInstructions.text: Dust the beef shin pieces with flour. Heat half of the oil in a large, deep casserole and cook the beef in batches for 2 minute on each side to brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.

Place the dried porcini in a bowl with 500ml of boiling water and rehydrate for 15 minutes. Add the remaining oil and onions to the casserole and cook for 4-5 minutes, tip in the mushrooms, garlic cloves and thyme sprigs cook for 5 minutes.
Add the beef shin to the pan, stir in the tomato puree and pour over the red wine and balsamic vinegar, dried mushrooms plus their liquid and the stock.
Bring to the boil, reduce the heat and simmer for 2.5 hours with the lid on. Remove the thyme and bones, scraping any marrow out and back into the sauce.
